summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing logistical arrangements for victim support during the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The emails focus on the process for getting a Crisis Response Canine (CRC) into the federal courthouse and courtroom to assist victims testifying at the trial beginning November 29, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the trial discussed in the email; her trial is set to begin on November 29, 2021, with four victims testifying.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Begins
events.description: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin with four victims testifying.

keyFacts: The Ghislaine Maxwell trial was scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021.
Four victims were expected to testify at the trial.
The FBI's Victim Services Division was coordinating to provide a Crisis Response Canine (CRC) to assist victims during the trial.
There were logistical challenges in getting a CRC into the federal courthouse and courtroom, as defense attorneys had previously argued it could bias the jury.
CRCs had been more successfully used during sentencings rather than trials in federal court.
